tooltip.pishock-zap.config.general.vibra:
Only vibrate the device, don't shock, even on death.
This can be used to test the mod or simply
provide a less intense experience.
For example, if you want to check your share codes work.
tooltip.pishock-zap.config.general.shock:
Shock the user on death with a
configurable intensity and duration.
If disabled, normal damage shocks will still occur.

Shock the user with an intensity
based on remaining health instead of damage.
This may encourage the user to stay healed up.
tooltip.pishock-zap.config.limits.durati: The duration of the shock/vibration by default
tooltip.pishock-zap.config.limits.max_du:
The maximum duration of the shock/vibration
if the duration is accumulated
(See backoff settings)
tooltip.pishock-zap.config.limits.vibrat:
The damage threshold at or below which
the device will vibrate instead of shocking
This is in half-hearts, so 1 is half a heart,
2 is a heart, etc.
Set to 0 to disable vibration, or
to 20 to save shocks for death only.

The minimum intensity of the vibration
on damage

The maximum intensity of the vibration
on damage (when just at threshold)
tooltip.pishock-zap.config.limits.shock_:
The minimum intensity of shocks on damage
(when just above threshold)

The maximum intensity of shocks on damage
i.e. when the player takes 20 hearts of damage
and "Shock on death" is disabled,
or the highest it can accumulate to via backoff
The intensity of shocks on death
The duration of shocks on death
Which devices to activate on damage
Which devices to activate on death
tooltip.pishock-zap.config.debounce.debo:
The minimum time between shocks/vibrations,
in seconds
For practical reasons, this is limited to 1 second.
tooltip.pishock-zap.config.debounce.accu:
Accumulate the duration of shocks/vibrations
If this is enabled, queued shocks/vibrations will be
combined and their durations added together.
Limits are of course still respected.
If weaker shocks are queued, they will
add less to the duration.

Accumulate the intensity of shocks/vibrations
If this is enabled, queued shocks/vibrations will be
combined and their intensities added together.
Limits are of course still respected.
This is similar to the effect of taking the damage all at once.
If this is disabled, the intensity of the resulting shock/vibration
will be the greatest of the queued shocks/vibrations.
Disabling it is easier on the user :)
If shock-on-health is enabled, this will be ignored.
tooltip.pishock-zap.config.debounce.queu:
Queue differently-sized shocks/vibrations separately
If this is enabled, during backoff, differently-sized
shocks/vibrations will not accumulate duration with
each other, and will instead be sent separately.
Disables intensity accumulation.
tooltip.pishock-zap.config.api.log_ident: The identifier to display in the PiShock logs
tooltip.pishock-zap.config.api.share_cod:
The share codes of the devices you want
